00045 sub listLocalSets{
00046   my $self = shift;
00047   my $db = $self->{db};
00048   my @found_sets;
00049   @found_sets = $db->listGlobalSets;
00050   my $out = {};
00051   $out->{ra_out} = \@found_sets;
00052   $out->{text} = encode_base64("Sets for course: ".$self->{courseName});
00053   return $out;
00054 }

00056 sub listLocalSetProblems{
00057     my $self = shift;
00058     my $in = shift;
00059     my $db = $self->{db};
00060     my @found_problems;
00061     my $selectedSet = $in->{set};
00062     warn "Finding problems for set ", $in->{set} if $UNIT_TESTS_ON;
00063     my $templateDir = $self->{ce}->{courseDirs}->{templates};
00064     @found_problems = $db->listGlobalProblems($selectedSet);
00065     my $problem;
00066     my @pg_files=();
00067     for $problem (@found_problems) {
00068         my $problemRecord = $db->getGlobalProblem($selectedSet, $problem); # checked
00069         die "global $problem for set $selectedSet not found." unless
00070         $problemRecord;
00071         push @pg_files, $templateDir."/".$problemRecord->source_file;
00072 
00073     }
00074     #@pg_files = sortByName(undef,@pg_files);
00075     
00076     my $out = {};
00077     $out->{ra_out} = \@pg_files;
00078     $out->{text} = encode_base64("Sets for course: ".$self->{courseName});
00079     return $out;
00080 }

00082 sub createNewSet{
00083     my $self = shift;
00084     my $in = shift;
00085     my $db = $self->{db};
00086     my $out;
00087     if ($in->{new_set_name} !~ /^[\w .-]*$/) {
00088         $out->{text} = "need a different name";#not sure the best way to handle and error
00089     } else {
00090             my $newSetName = $in->{new_set_name};
00091             # if we want to munge the input set name, do it here
00092             $newSetName =~ s/\s/_/g;
00093             #debug("local_sets was ", $r->param('local_sets'));
00094             #$r->param('local_sets',$newSetName);  ## use of two parameter param
00095             #debug("new value of local_sets is ", $r->param('local_sets'));
00096             my $newSetRecord = $db->getGlobalSet($newSetName);
00097             if (defined($newSetRecord)) {
00098                 $out->{text} = encode_base64("Failed to create set, you may need to try another name.");
00099             } else {            # Do it!
00100                 # DBFIXME use $db->newGlobalSet
00101                 $newSetRecord = $db->{set}->{record}->new();
00102                 $newSetRecord->set_id($newSetName);
00103                 $newSetRecord->set_header("defaultHeader");
00104                 $newSetRecord->hardcopy_header("defaultHeader");
00105                 $newSetRecord->open_date(time()+60*60*24*7); # in one week
00106                 $newSetRecord->due_date(time()+60*60*24*7*2); # in two weeks
00107                 $newSetRecord->answer_date(time()+60*60*24*7*3); # in three weeks
00108                 eval {$db->addGlobalSet($newSetRecord)};
00109                 if ($@) {
00110                     $out->{text} = encode_base64("Failed to create set, you may need to try another name.");
00111                     #$self->addbadmessage("Problem creating set $newSetName<br> $@");
00112                 } else {
00113                     #figure this bit out later
00114                     #$self->addgoodmessage("Set $newSetName has been created.");
00115                     my $selfassign = $in->{selfassign};
00116                     $selfassign = "" if($selfassign =~ /false/i); # deal with javascript false
00117                     if($selfassign) {
00118                         $self->assignSetToUser($self->{user}, $newSetRecord);
00119                         #$self->addgoodmessage("Set $newSetName was assigned to $userName.");
00120                     }
00121                 }
00122             }
00123     }
00124 }

00127 sub reorderProblems {
00128     my $self = shift;
00129     my $in = shift;
00130     my $db = $self->{db};
00131     my $setID = $in->{set};
00132     my $problemListString = $in->{probList};
00133     my @problemList = split(/,/, $problemListString);
00134     my $topdir = $self->{ce}->{courseDirs}{templates};
00135     #my (@problemIDList) = @_;
00136     #my ($prob1, $prob2, $prob);
00137     my $index = 1;
00138     #get all the problems
00139     my @problems = ();
00140     foreach my $path (@problemList) {
00141         $path =~ s|^$topdir/*||;
00142         #this will work if i can get problems by name
00143         my $problemRecord; # checked
00144         foreach my $problem ($db->listGlobalProblems($setID)) {
00145             my $tempProblem = $db->getGlobalProblem($setID, $problem);
00146             if($tempProblem->source_file eq $path){
00147                 $problemRecord = $tempProblem;
00148             }
00149         }
00150         die "global " .$path ." for set $setID not found." unless $problemRecord;
00151         #print "found this problem to be reordered: ".$problemRecord."\n";
00152         push @problems, $problemRecord;
00153         $index = $index + 1;
00154     }
00155     #then change their info
00156     my @setUsers = $db->listSetUsers($setID);
00157     my $user;
00158     $index = 1;
00159     foreach my $problem (@problems) {
00160         $problem->problem_id($index);
00161         die "global $problem not found." unless $problem;
00162         #print "problem to be reordered: ".$problem."\n";
00163         $db->putGlobalProblem($problem);
00164       
00165         #need to deal with users?
00166         foreach $user (@setUsers) {
00167             #my $prob1 = $db->getUserProblem($user, $setID, $index);
00168             #die " problem $index for set $setID and effective user $user not found"    unless $prob1;
00169             #$prob1->problem_id($index);
00170             #$db->putUserProblem($prob1);
00171         }
00172         $index = $index + 1;
00173     }
00174     my $out->{text} = encode_base64("Successfully reordered problems");
00175     return $out;
00176 }

00180 sub assignProblemToUser {
00181     my $self = shift;
00182     my $userID = shift;
00183     my $GlobalProblem = shift;
00184     my $seed = shift;;
00185     my $db = $self->{db};
00186     
00187     my $UserProblem = $db->newUserProblem;
00188     $UserProblem->user_id($userID);
00189     $UserProblem->set_id($GlobalProblem->set_id);
00190     $UserProblem->problem_id($GlobalProblem->problem_id);
00191     initializeUserProblem($UserProblem, $seed);
00192     
00193     eval { $db->addUserProblem($UserProblem) };
00194     if ($@) {
00195         if ($@ =~ m/user problem exists/) {
00196             return "problem " . $GlobalProblem->problem_id
00197                 . " in set " . $GlobalProblem->set_id
00198                 . " is already assigned to user $userID.";
00199         } else {
00200             die $@;
00201         }
00202     }
00203     
00204     return ();
00205 }

00207 sub assignProblemToAllSetUsers {
00208     my $self = shift;
00209     my $GlobalProblem = shift;
00210     my $db = $self->{db};
00211     my $setID = $GlobalProblem->set_id;
00212     my @userIDs = $db->listSetUsers($setID);
00213     
00214     my @results;
00215     
00216     foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00217         my @result = assignProblemToUser($self, $userID, $GlobalProblem);
00218         push @results, @result if @result;
00219     }
00220     
00221     return @results;
00222 }

00224 sub addProblemToSet {
00225     my $self = shift;
00226     my $args = shift;
00227     my $db = $self->{db};
00228     my $value_default = $self->{ce}->{problemDefaults}->{value};
00229     my $max_attempts_default = $self->{ce}->{problemDefaults}->{max_attempts};  
00230     
00231 
00232     die "addProblemToSet called without specifying the set name." if $args->{setName} eq "";
00233     my $setName = $args->{setName};
00234 
00235     my $sourceFile = $args->{sourceFile} or 
00236         die "addProblemToSet called without specifying the sourceFile.";
00237 
00238     # The rest of the arguments are optional
00239     
00240 #   my $value = $args{value} || $value_default;
00241     my $value = $value_default;
00242     if (defined($args->{value})){$value = $args->{value};}  # 0 is a valid value for $args{value}  
00243 
00244     my $maxAttempts = $args->{maxAttempts} || $max_attempts_default;
00245     my $problemID = $args->{problemID};
00246 
00247     unless ($problemID) {
00248         $problemID = WeBWorK::Utils::max($db->listGlobalProblems($setName)) + 1;
00249     }
00250 
00251     my $problemRecord = $db->newGlobalProblem;
00252     $problemRecord->problem_id($problemID);
00253     $problemRecord->set_id($setName);
00254     $problemRecord->source_file($sourceFile);
00255     $problemRecord->value($value);
00256     $problemRecord->max_attempts($maxAttempts);
00257     $db->addGlobalProblem($problemRecord);
00258 
00259     return $problemRecord;
00260 }

00262 sub addProblem {
00263     my $self = shift;
00264     my $in = shift;
00265     my $db = $self->{db};
00266     my $setName = $in->{set};
00267     my $file = $in->{path};
00268     my $topdir = $self->{ce}->{courseDirs}{templates};
00269     $file =~ s|^$topdir/*||;
00270     my $freeProblemID;
00271     # DBFIXME count would work just as well
00272     $freeProblemID = max($db->listGlobalProblems($setName)) + 1;
00273     my $problemRecord = addProblemToSet($self, {setName => $setName, sourceFile => $file, problemID => $freeProblemID});
00274     assignProblemToAllSetUsers($self, $problemRecord);
00275     my $out->{text} = encode_base64("Problem added to ".$setName);
00276     return $out;
00277 }

00279 sub deleteProblem {
00280     my $self = shift;
00281     my $in = shift;
00282     my $db = $self->{db};
00283     my $setName = $in->{set};
00284     
00285     my $file = $in->{path};
00286     my $topdir = $self->{ce}->{courseDirs}{templates};
00287     $file =~ s|^$topdir/*||;
00288     # DBFIXME count would work just as well
00289     foreach my $problem ($db->listGlobalProblems($setName)) {
00290         my $problemRecord = $db->getGlobalProblem($setName, $problem);
00291         
00292         if($problemRecord->source_file eq $file){
00293             #print "found it";
00294             $db->deleteGlobalProblem($setName, $problemRecord->problem_id);
00295         }
00296     }
00297     my $out->{text} = encode_base64("Problem removed from ".$setName);
00298     return $out;
00299 }

00302 ## Search for set definition files
00303 use File::Find;
00304 sub get_set_defs {
00305     my $self = shift;
00306     my $topdir = $self->{ce}->{courseDirs}{templates};#shift #sort of hard coded for now;
00307     my @found_set_defs;
00308     # get_set_defs_wanted is a closure over @found_set_defs
00309     my $get_set_defs_wanted = sub {
00310         #my $fn = $_;
00311         #my $fdir = $File::Find::dir;
00312         #return() if($fn !~ /^set.*\.def$/);
00313         ##return() if(not -T $fn);
00314         #push @found_set_defs, "$fdir/$fn";
00315         push @found_set_defs, $_ if m|/set[^/]*\.def$|;
00316     };
00317     find({ wanted => $get_set_defs_wanted, follow_fast=>1, no_chdir=>1}, $topdir);
00318     map { $_ =~ s|^$topdir/?|| } @found_set_defs;
00319     my $out = {};
00320     $out->{ra_out} = \@found_set_defs;
00321     return $out;
00322 }

00324 ## Try to make reading of set defs more flexible.  Additional strategies
00325 ## for fixing a path can be added here.
00326 
00327 sub munge_pg_file_path {
00328     my $self = shift;
00329     my $pg_path = shift;
00330     my $path_to_set_def = shift;
00331     my $end_path = $pg_path;
00332     # if the path is ok, don't fix it
00333     return($pg_path) if(-e $self->r->ce->{courseDirs}{templates}."/$pg_path");
00334     # if we have followed a link into a self contained course to get
00335     # to the set.def file, we need to insert the start of the path to
00336     # the set.def file
00337     $end_path = "$path_to_set_def/$pg_path";
00338     return($end_path) if(-e $self->r->ce->{courseDirs}{templates}."/$end_path");
00339     # if we got this far, this path is bad, but we let it produce
00340     # an error so the user knows there is a troublesome path in the
00341     # set.def file.
00342     return($pg_path);
00343 }
00344 
00345 ## Read a set definition file.  This could be abstracted since it happens
00346 ## elsewhere.  Here we don't have to process so much of the file.
00347 
00348 sub read_set_def {
00349     my $self = shift;
00350     my $r = $self->r;
00351     my $filePathOrig = shift;
00352     my $filePath = $r->ce->{courseDirs}{templates}."/$filePathOrig";
00353     $filePathOrig =~ s/set.*\.def$//;
00354     $filePathOrig =~ s|/$||;
00355     $filePathOrig = "." if ($filePathOrig !~ /\S/);
00356     my @pg_files = ();
00357     my ($line, $got_to_pgs, $name, @rest) = ("", 0, "");
00358     if ( open (SETFILENAME, "$filePath") )    {
00359         while($line = <SETFILENAME>) {
00360             chomp($line);
00361             $line =~ s|(#.*)||; # don't read past comments
00362             if($got_to_pgs) {
00363                 unless ($line =~ /\S/) {next;} # skip blank lines
00364                 ($name,@rest) = split (/\s*,\s*/,$line);
00365                 $name =~ s/\s*//g;
00366                 push @pg_files, $name;
00367             } else {
00368                 $got_to_pgs = 1 if ($line =~ /problemList\s*=/);
00369             }
00370         }
00371     } else {
00372         $self->addbadmessage("Cannot open $filePath");
00373     }
00374     # This is where we would potentially munge the pg file paths
00375     # One possibility
00376     @pg_files = map { $self->munge_pg_file_path($_, $filePathOrig) } @pg_files;
00377     return(@pg_files);
00378 }
